comment: Professor Jenkins was absent for most of the semester. She graded papers from January in May, which left us clueless about our progress. In the end, the most intensive assignments were the ones that she chose to make a completion grade. Most of the class got a "B," but she definitely destroyed GPAs.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Im sorry but this class is just outrageous. The workload is lowkey disrespectful and the entire class itself is completely unorganized. Only 1/2 of the assignments are listed in upcoming events and the requirements for each part is out of pocket. Also, she is not very nice/helpful when you ask questions or respectfully ask for clarification
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: From a 5 yr student, I was petrified to take this class. I am writing this review to help you all out. The prof was straight forward, organized, helpful, accessible and fair. Most of all, I learned from this class. Yes the simulation and projects are time consuming, but they are absolutely doable! Take my word and choose her over others.
Didn't respond to a single email I send her this semester. Exam questions are difficult and hard to answer from the assigned reading.

This is a hard class so be prepared. The first two exam comes directly from the textbook. The third exam is the simulation (individually). Pick a good group for the simulation because that will determine most of your grade. The other part is 6 easy assignments in the beginning. Start the final papers early! The simulation is hard and complicated.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: We are only a week into the class, but I already don't like her. She just sent us an email saying "I do not like failing students, but if it comes to that, I have no problem doing so." Who starts a semester off like this? Seriously lady, get off your high horse. Work load is ridiculous and the management software MM is overly complicated to use.
I loved this professor. Very down-to-earth and straight forward. Class is very practical. Just come to class and you can make a B+/A on the tests.

The class is pretty easy. There are two test(study the PowerPoint),do the paper over the emyth(easy read),do the franchise questionnaire in class when franchises come to class, and do the FDD project. Attendance and participation counts for 10% each of your final grade. Don't put off the fdd til last minute. Don't be scared of the fdd &presentation

Professor Jenkins was a very understanding and respectful professor. Half of the grade is MicroMatics which can be stressful, but if you understand it, you will pass easily. The semester is broken into 2 categories - book and micromatic. Book is not necessary if you paid attention to previous classes and PPT. Not an easy A, but very obtainable A.

Great professor!  She takes attendance but it only counts for 10% of final grade.  Only had a few assignments.  Tests were simple-  if she marked you wrong and you could support your answer she would adjust your grade.  Very flexible on grading.  I'm taking her again next semester because she was so good.

She has real business experience. The grades are not given out they are earned. If you do the work and do not procrastinate you will be fine. We did not have a graded assignment until 34 through the class so be prepared for that. Her class was always interesting and the guest speakers she provided are great future contacts. She is amazing.

I'm currently taking her class and I think she's great! She has first-hand entrepreneurial experience and can give examples, the lectures aren't boring, and the grading is fair. The book is helpful, but you could get by with just going over the Powerpoints. Would take her for another class!
